intro: Capurodendron andrafiamenae, commonly known as the Andrafiamena tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
